title: How to Cook a Chuck Roast Soup over Mashed Potatoes

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients needed.
steps.description: See the Ingredients and Things You'll Need sections in advance.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 360 °F (182 °C).
Boil the water.
steps.description: Set 3 gallons (11 L) of lukewarm tap water aside in a container for use later on. Set 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) of lukewarm tap water in a 6-quart (1.5 gal) stockpot for other use later on.

steps.headline: Chop the vegetables.
steps.description: Mince 2 onions, 6 carrots, and 1 stalk of celery. Chop into small pieces. Determine what an appropriate size is. The smaller the pieces, the faster they will cook. Set the chopped vegetables aside without mixing them. Make sure the pieces are of equal size so that they won't finish cooking at separate times.

steps.headline: Peel the potatoes and chop into large chunks.
Prepare the chuck roast.
steps.description: Trim the fat off of the chuck roast with a steak knife. Trim loosely as it is beneficial to have some fat on it for taste and texture.

steps.headline: Cut the chuck roast into 10 large chunks.
steps.description: Make sure each one weighs about 7 ounces (0.4375 lbs, 0.875 cups, 207.015 mL).

steps.headline: Turn the gas or electric stove top on.
steps.description: Turn one burner on medium to high heat.

steps.headline: Set the 16-quart (4 gals) stockpot on the stove top.
Pour all the olive oil into the pot and let it sit for 3 minutes.
Pour in all the onions, and let them sit until golden brown.
steps.description: Intermediately stir with a wooden spoon so they don’t become stuck to the bottom of the pot

steps.headline: Pour in the celery, carrots, and onions.
steps.description: Let them sit for 5 minutes with continuous stirring with the wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Pour in all meat chunks.
steps.description: Sear them within the pot for about 10 minutes, continuously flipping the meat so it achieves a golden brown color equally on all sides.

steps.headline: Add 3 gallons (11 L) of water into the stockpot with the vegetables and meat.
Add 2 cups (470 mL) of marinara sauce along with the 4 tablespoons (59 mL) of tomato paste.
steps.description: Mix the pot until it is well blended.

steps.headline: Add in the seasoning.
steps.description: Pour in 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of salt, black pepper, parsley, and oregano. Evenly distribute it throughout the mixture.

steps.headline: Turn the burner off and cover the pot with aluminum foil.
steps.description: Put the pot into the oven to cook for 2 and a half hours at 360 °F (182 °C).

steps.headline: Pour the 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) of water into a 6 quart (1.5 gal) stockpot.
steps.description: Set on a separate stove top burner on high heat. Bring this to a boil, which should take about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the chopped potatoes into the 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) simmer of water.
steps.description: Set aside and let them boil for approximately 25-30 minutes. Strain the potatoes when done.

steps.headline: Pour potatoes into a blender and blend at medium speed for 6 minutes.
steps.description: As they are being blended, pour in 2 cups (470 mL) milk, 1 stick of butter, 1 tablespoon (15 mL) salt, and 2 teaspoons (9.9 mL) white pepper.

steps.headline: Serve the potatoes into 10 bowls.
steps.description: When the pot roast is done cooking, pull out of the oven and pour over the mashed potatoes. Wait 2-3 minutes for the roast to cool down, and enjoy!

text: Preparation Gather the ingredients needed. See the Ingredients and Things You'll Need sections in advance. Preheat the oven to 360 °F (182 °C).  Boil the water. Set 3 gallons (11 L) of lukewarm tap water aside in a container for use later on. Set 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) of lukewarm tap water in a 6-quart (1.5 gal) stockpot for other use later on. Chop the vegetables. Mince 2 onions, 6 carrots, and 1 stalk of celery. Chop into small pieces. Determine what an appropriate size is. The smaller the pieces, the faster they will cook. Set the chopped vegetables aside without mixing them. Make sure the pieces are of equal size so that they won't finish cooking at separate times. Peel the potatoes and chop into large chunks. Set aside separately. Prepare the chuck roast. Trim the fat off of the chuck roast with a steak knife. Trim loosely as it is beneficial to have some fat on it for taste and texture. Cut the chuck roast into 10 large chunks. Make sure each one weighs about 7 ounces (0.4375 lbs, 0.875 cups, 207.015 mL). Turn the gas or electric stove top on. Turn one burner on medium to high heat. Set the 16-quart (4 gals) stockpot on the stove top.  Cooking Pour all the olive oil into the pot and let it sit for 3 minutes.  Pour in all the onions, and let them sit until golden brown. Intermediately stir with a wooden spoon so they don’t become stuck to the bottom of the pot Pour in the celery, carrots, and onions. Let them sit for 5 minutes with continuous stirring with the wooden spoon. Pour in all meat chunks. Sear them within the pot for about 10 minutes, continuously flipping the meat so it achieves a golden brown color equally on all sides. Add 3 gallons (11 L) of water into the stockpot with the vegetables and meat. Pour in beef broth. Add 2 cups (470 mL) of marinara sauce along with the 4 tablespoons (59 mL) of tomato paste. Mix the pot until it is well blended. Add in the seasoning. Pour in 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of salt, black pepper, parsley, and oregano. Evenly distribute it throughout the mixture. Turn the burner off and cover the pot with aluminum foil. Put the pot into the oven to cook for 2 and a half hours at 360 °F (182 °C). Pour the 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) of water into a 6 quart (1.5 gal) stockpot. Set on a separate stove top burner on high heat. Bring this to a boil, which should take about 10 minutes. Pour in the chopped potatoes into the 1.5 gallons (5.7 L) simmer of water. Set aside and let them boil for approximately 25-30 minutes. Strain the potatoes when done. Pour potatoes into a blender and blend at medium speed for 6 minutes. As they are being blended, pour in 2 cups (470 mL) milk, 1 stick of butter, 1 tablespoon (15 mL) salt, and 2 teaspoons (9.9 mL) white pepper. Serve the potatoes into 10 bowls. When the pot roast is done cooking, pull out of the oven and pour over the mashed potatoes. Wait 2-3 minutes for the roast to cool down, and enjoy!
